Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Necklace with a shell pendant
Description: This unique necklace with rows comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Rifa. It is composed of beads of bone, beads of blue-green faience and beads of cornaline, split on both sides by a large shell which was the pendant. The piece dates from the Middle Kingdom or from the 2nd Intermediate Period.
